definition: lit. ten thousand mile horse/fine steed
see 鞦韆|秋千[qiu1 qian1]
thousand

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Li (surname)
lining/interior/inside/internal/also written 裏|里[li3]
variant of 裡|里[li3]
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
lit. there are many swift horses, but very few who can spot them (idiom)/fig. many have talent, but few can recognize talent when they see it
pinyin: qian1 li3 ma3 chang2 you3 , er2 Bo2 Le4 bu4 chang2 you3
containing_words.word: 千里马常有，而伯乐不常有

sentences.english: The horse arrived, and it was a rare " thousand-mile".
sentences.chinese: 马到了，果然是一匹天下少有的千里马。

sentences.english: You can take metro, it is Yonggwang station of Chollima line.
sentences.chinese: 您可搭乘平壤地铁，千里马线，荣光车站。

sentences.english: We thank Ksitigarbha for his help and Buddy Horse of A Thousand Miles for his leading the road.
sentences.chinese: 我们感谢千里马的领路，感激地藏王的普渡。

sentences.english: Chollima's chances of winning might be as mythical as the horse of their name.
sentences.chinese: 千里马球队获胜的希望就像他的名字一样遥不可及。

sentences.english: Wei plays down his role as the guy who spotted the winning horse.
sentences.chinese: 韦必达在其中做了伯乐，认出了千里马。

sentences.english: Chollima who will become the real estate industry?
sentences.chinese: 千里马谁将成为房地产行业？

sentences.english: Only their own people in all its aspects has been recognized only someone know Chollima .
sentences.chinese: 只有自己的各方面得到人家认可才会有人识千里马。

sentences.english: I wish you are always running horse.
sentences.chinese: 愿你是永远奔腾的千里马。

definition: Bo Le (horse connoisseur during Spring and Autumn Period)/a good judge of talent/talent scout
talented field commander (military)
an old horse knows the way (idiom); an experienced worker knows what to do/an old hand knows the ropes
to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
expert at appointing people according to their abilities (idiom)/to put the right people in the right places
Easy to raise an army of one thousand, but hard to find a good general. (idiom)
pinyin: qian1 jun1 yi4 de2 , yi1 jiang4 nan2 qiu2

definition: a nobody/a nonentity
solid learning/real ability and learning/genuine talent
saddle horse/mount
a genius/a talented person
a fine bird chooses a tree to nest in (proverb)/fig. a talented person chooses a patron of integrity
pinyin: liang2 qin2 ze2 mu4 er2 qi1

definition: mediocrity
to recognize talent
having both integrity and talent (idiom)
of great talent (idiom)
not all gold is sufficiently red (idiom); no-one is perfect
